headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Apple, Oracle, Klarna, Synopsys
summary: ↗️ Oracle (ORCL): The software company forecast huge gains in cloud-infrastructure revenue, giving investors reason to overlook quarterly results that missed expectations. Shares surged 36% and fueled a rally in AI-related stocks, including Broadcom (AVGO), Nvidia (NVDA) and TSMC (TSM).

content.title: Stocks to Watch Recap: Apple, Oracle, Klarna, Synopsys

Shares surged 36% and fueled a rally in AI-related stocks, including Broadcom (AVGO), Nvidia (NVDA) and TSMC (TSM).

headline: There Are More Losers Than Gainers Today. The S&P 500 Is Still on Track for New High.
summary: Less than half of the stocks in the S&P 500 are higher today, yet the index is readying for another record.  The S&P 500 is up 0.5%, while the Dow and Nasdaq are down 0.5% and up 0.4%, respectively.  The gain in the S&P 500 comes despite 319, or more than half of its stocks, declining today.

content.title: There Are More Losers Than Gainers Today. The S&P 500 Is Still on Track for New High.
content.summary: Less than half of the stocks in the S&P 500 are higher today, yet the index is readying for another record.  The S&P 500 is up 0.5%, while the Dow and Nasdaq are down 0.5% and up 0.4%, respectively.  The gain in the S&P 500 comes despite 319, or more than half of its stocks, declining today.

headline: Synopsys set to wipe out 2025 gains as shares tank on China business woes
summary: This has hurt Synopsys, which provides software for designing complex processors.  It recorded weakness in its IP business in the quarter, which CEO Sassine Ghazi attributed to export restrictions disrupting business in China and challenges at a major foundry customer.  Synopsys faced over a month of U.S. export curbs on chip design software to China, essentially cutting off the market that brings over 10% of revenue for major industry players.

content.title: Synopsys set to wipe out 2025 gains as shares tank on China business woes
content.summary: This has hurt Synopsys, which provides software for designing complex processors.  It recorded weakness in its IP business in the quarter, which CEO Sassine Ghazi attributed to export restrictions disrupting business in China and challenges at a major foundry customer.  Synopsys faced over a month of U.S. export curbs on chip design software to China, essentially cutting off the market that brings over 10% of revenue for major industry players.

headline: Synopsys Stock Plummets 34% After Earnings. Here’s Why.
summary: Synopsys  stock was headed for its worst same-day percent decrease on record on Wednesday.  Sysnopsys reported adjusted earnings of $3.39 a share, missing the $3.80 a share analysts had forecast, while revenue of $1.74 billion came in below the $1.77 billion Wall Street had forecast, according to FactSet.  CEO Sassine Ghazi noted on the earnings call that an 8% drop in revenue within the company’s semiconductor intellectual property, or IP, business drove underperformance in the quarter.

content.title: Synopsys Stock Plummets 34% After Earnings. Here’s Why.
content.summary: Synopsys  stock was headed for its worst same-day percent decrease on record on Wednesday.  Sysnopsys reported adjusted earnings of $3.39 a share, missing the $3.80 a share analysts had forecast, while revenue of $1.74 billion came in below the $1.77 billion Wall Street had forecast, according to FactSet.  CEO Sassine Ghazi noted on the earnings call that an 8% drop in revenue within the company’s semiconductor intellectual property, or IP, business drove underperformance in the quarter.

headline: GameStop, Synopsys, Chewy: Trending tickers
summary: GameStop (GME) shares rise sharply in after-hours trading as the retailer reported its fifth straight quarterly profit. Synopsys (SNPS) falls more than 20% as restrictions on sales of US chips to China weigh on demand. Chewy (CHWI), the online retailes of pet food, drops on disappointing guidance, despite earnings mostly in line with expectations. Join Ramzan Karmali on Yahoo Finance's Market Sunrise for the latest news on trending stocks.
